subject: RE: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: ... ...or it could simply be that you only need two roads, rather than 20. If you test by codepath analysis rather than input/output combinations, you may
messageBody:
Quoting Anil and Rita Philip <anil_rita@...>:

> It's not just knowing that the road was traveled, but
> that it was well traveled.

...or it could simply be that you only need two roads, rather than 20. If you
test by codepath analysis rather than input/output combinations, you may never
realize that two roads can do the work of 20.

> So maybe the debugger will never lose its place.

Maybe. Relegating it to the back room is enough, though.

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.
